notes.reading-notes:
SAMPLE READING NOTES
TOPIC: Thomas Jefferson, Secretary of State in the first administration of the United States under George Washington
Jefferson's beliefs (Republican) about the best path for the U.S.:
agricultural society
free trade (no protective tariffs)
more power for states than for federal government
strict interpretation of the Constitution (powers not named go to the states)
notes.listening-notes:
SAMPLE LISTENING NOTES
TOPIC: Alexander Hamilton, Secretary of the Treasury in the first administration of the United States under George Washington
Hamilton's beliefs (Federalist) about the best path for the U.S.:
industrial society
high tariffs on imported manufactured goods
strong central government
broad interpretation of the Constitution (powers not named go to the federal government)
